triggers: how do i goldenize and keep it base
how do i goldenize and keep it level 4
entries.response:
To goldenize and keep a Pokémon base/Level 4:

1) Teach the Pokémon a **non-damaging move** (for example: Haze).
2) Let that Pokémon **faint** in the battle.
3) Switch to a **higher-level Pokémon** to defeat the Eevee.

Because the goldenized Pokémon did not deal damage, it will remain base/Level 4.

triggers: how do you make a pokemon golden
how to make a golden pokemon
entries.response:
To goldenize a Pokémon:

• Solve the **community riddle** to find **3 Pokémon and 3 items**.
• Place the Pokémon in the **first three slots** of your roster.
• Attach the **corresponding items** to those Pokémon in the correct order.
• Go to the **Evolution Gym**.
• Defeat the Eevee.

After the battle, the **first Pokémon in your roster becomes golden**.

triggers: can i goldenize on christmas and new years
goldenize on christmas and new years
do christmas and new years count separately
are christmas and new years separate golden days
entries.response:
Yes. **Christmas and New Year’s count as separate Golden Days**.

Even though they usually share the same goldens, you may goldenize your **full allowed amount on each day**.

triggers: how many goldens can i make
how many golds can i make
entries.response:
Golden limits depend on activity:

**Active users**:
• 1 golden per account per Golden Day
• Up to **5 total per Golden Day**
• Applies separately to:
  – Christmas
  – New Year’s
  – August 2nd

**Inactive users**:
• 1 golden per Golden Day
• Total of **2** during Christmas/New Year’s
• **1** on August 2nd

triggers: what days can i make golds

triggers: what does UL, b/o, nft, etc mean
entries.response:
Here are common TPPC terms and their meanings:

• **TPPCRPG** – The Pokémon PokeCenter Role Playing Game
• **LF** – "Looking For" ____ Pokémon
• **FT / NFT** – Pokémon is "For Trade" or "Not For Trade"
• **FS** – Pokémon is "For Sale"
• **'x' / 'kx'** – Non-official rating system; 1 'x' historically = Level 2499, 'kx' = thousands of 'x'
• **NG / OG** – "New Gold" (latest Golden Pokémon) / "Old Gold" (released long ago)
• **GDay** – Day Golden Pokémon can be created (e.g., August 2nd, Christmas/New Years)
• **B/O** – "Best Offer" auction; offer accepted at original time without reserve
• **UE / UG** – "Unevolved / Ungoldenised"; Pokémon may become Golden later
• **E / G** – "Evolved / Goldenised"; Pokémon cannot become Golden later
• **PPP** – Power Plant Prize
• **Unob** – Unobtainable Pokémon
• **SS** – Secret Swap
• **TC** – Trainer's Corner forum or Training Challenge
• **S / D / G** – Bonus of Pokémon: Shiny, Dark, Golden
• **U** – Ungendered Pokémon
• **G** – Genderless Pokémon (example: Deoxys G 2499)
• **TPs** – Team Points (see Team Stats)
• **HTT** – Hard To Trade; difficult or undesirable Pokémon
• **ETT** – Easy To Trade; desirable Pokémon
• **UL** – Underleveled Pokémon
• **CAT / C.A.T** – Create A Trade
• **1k** – Pokémon level in thousands (1k = Level 1000, 2k = Level 2000, etc.)
• **Base** – Lowest level available for a Pokémon
• **NB** – Non-base; higher than base level
• **Up / Downgrade** – Consolidate multiple Pokémon into one valuable Pokémon, or vice versa
• **Maps** – Pokémon caught on maps
• **Swaps** – Pokémon obtained via Secret Swap
• **Promo** – Promotional Pokémon from team stats (1 per account/week, up to 5 if multiple accounts)
• **nty** – "No thank you"
• **SFOM** – Sack Full of Muck (forum off-topic)
• **ig** – In game; refers to rarity list

triggers: why didnt I receive the full price for the pokemon I sold
entries.response:
Once your Pokémon is bought, you will receive **half of its market value** — you have to pay the tax man! Players on the team which is currently in control of the **Power Plant** receive **33% off** on the Buy Pokémon page. This discount only applies to the buyer; the seller still ends up making **half of the market value of the original, non-discounted price**.

See here for more info: https://wiki.tppc.info/Buying_and_Selling_Guide
